<QuestionSource url="https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/ai-code-practice">
# Summary of Article: "Drawing-up a General-Purpose AI Code of Practice"

## Key Facts and Process Details:

**Timeline and Status:**
- The European AI Office facilitated the drawing-up of the General-Purpose AI Code of Practice
- AI Act rules on GPAI apply from August 2, 2025
- Kick-off Event held on September 30 (year not specified, but context suggests 2024)
- Call to participate launched by AI Office on July 30, 2024
- Following the kick-off, participants convened three times virtually for drafting rounds
- The article describes the process "until the publication of the Code"

**Process Characteristics:**
- The Code was prepared in an "iterative drafting process"
- Process was chaired by independent experts
- Nearly 1000 stakeholders involved
- Included EU Member States representatives, European and international observers
- The Code represents a voluntary tool designed to help industry comply with AI Act rules on general-purpose AI

**Stakeholder Involvement:**
- Professional organizations, GPAI model providers, downstream providers, industry organizations, civil society, rightsholders, academia, and independent experts participated
- Plenary structured in four working groups on specific topics
- Chairs and vice-chairs selected and appointed by the AI Office from independent experts
- Participants could express comments during meetings or within two weeks in writing
- EU Member States representatives involved via the AI Board
- International public bodies and agencies invited as observers

**Parallel Activities:**
- AI Office is developing a template on training data summaries (required under Article 53(1)d) of the AI Act)
- Multi-stakeholder consultation on general-purpose AI received more than 430 responses

**Note:** The article appears to be describing the initial drafting process and does not explicitly mention plans for revised drafts or future versions.
</QuestionSource>
